runs.comm: starts with the perfect inswinger, headed for top of off, gets an inside edge onto the pad

huge belter of a shout from Sangakkara, he was headed well down the leg side himself as this was swinging down d down the leg side, but boy did he let that appeal rip? Correctly called not out because of the huge swing. It his him in front of middle
gets a thick edge on a drive outside off, gets the single
worked off the hips for a single
square-drive, but straight to point, on the bounce
driven on the up, to cover, doesn't find the gap
length ball on the pads, pushed back to the bowler
worked off the hips for a single
typical Watson shot, plants the big front foot down, and biffs this length ball over mid-on... this will fast-track the introduction of spin
heaved away, along the ground, wide of midwicket, gets a couple
the crowd is stunned into silence here. This is short and wide, and nonchalantly cut away for four. Not the smartest delivery with the third man up
half-steer-half-edged for four, this is just short of a length outside off, and he is always looking to open the face, but this goes much finer than expected
punched on the up, wide of mid-off
short ball, bread and butter for Warner, pulled along the ground for four
back of a length, pushed to mid-on for a quick single
shot... beautiful cover-drive, on the up, along the ground, and rickets between cover and extra cover. This wasn't even driving length
full ball, hit straight to midwicket
Lovely lovely shot... violent but good to watch. Hit on the up, absolutely murdered between the bowler and the stumps. All along the ground
that's a switch-hit, it appears he changed his grip there, tossed up on the leg stump and he changes his grip and slog-sweeps it past extra cover for a cracking boundary
pushed into the leg side
turned away into the leg side off the back foot
went on straight and he played inside the line, expecting it to turn, got a thick outside edge into the off side
slog-sweep, he plays that well and deposits one into the stands, flighted on middle and off and Watson punishes it

another one, Australia are dominating this chase, bowled flatter by Dilruwan on the off stump but Watto had made up his mind, bent low, took it from outside off and smote it into the crowd behind the deep midwicket boundary
starts off with the carrom ball that leaves the left-hand batsmen. The leading edge doesn't reach short third on the full
another carrom ball, beats Watson, but it is headed down the leg side. Mini collision between Herath and Warner. Warner lets him have a moutful
long hop, oh ho ho, you are asking for trouble Rangana... Watson pulls this over long-on for a huge six - three sixes in last four balls
mis-hit for six... Watto's fourth off the last five balls he has faced. he went for the slog sweep here, didn't quite reach the pitch of the ball, but still sent it sailing over wide long-on
another attempt at a huge six, but this time he gets a bottom edge onto the pads
flat ball, and Watson rocks back to cut this for four to bring up a sensational fifty. Australia are running away
short on the pads, and Warner hands it over to Watson with a single to leg
flat and quick, Watson opens the face on it, can't beat short third man
the googly from Mendis. Doesn't matter to Watson. He sees the flight, opens up the front leg, and slogs it over long-on. Just over, might I add
quicker, flatter again, and hit straight to extra cover
the slog sweep gets Watson after five sixes... this I suspect is the carrom ball that leaves Watson, and takes the top edge as he goes for his sixth six. Thisara Perera takes the catch at long-off
another carom ball, gets the inside edge from Warner, but he manages the single to short fine
carrom ball, Warner doesn't read it, is beaten as it leaves him. Warner is playing for the one coming in
length ball outside off, driven straight to extra cover
some dip on this one, and driven back to Herath
quick, flat on the pads, played to midwicket
pushed through again, this time Warner gets a single to long-off
full and straight, Hussey plays a respectful forward defensive

My word. We need a new scoring entry for this. Caught Jayawardene b Mendis simply won't do! Sit down and hear this out. Warner slog-sweeps this, Mathews takes the catch at the edge of midwicket boundary, but just as he is about to run over the fence with his momentum, he throws the ball back in - both his feet in the air. The closest fielder is 30 metres from him, but he has lobbed it back that far! Australia can't believe it. The replays aren't lying. Top presence of mind from Mathews and Mahela. Relayed Mathews caught Jayawardene bowled Mendis!
huge huge shout, wonder why this is not given... carrom ball, pitches leg, turning in, missing leg. Top decision under pressure
another carrom ball, quick and fast, pushed back to Mendis

Marsh couldn't read Mendis if he wrote it in all caps... this is the fllghted googly, Marsh is sucked out of the crease, is beaten in the flight, plays for the legbreak, is beaten by the turn away from him. Sanga does the rest. Boy, are Sri Lanka back in this one?
whoa, tentative forward defensive shot

Double-wicket maiden! Carrom ball this time, pushed to extra cover. This over was Sri Lankan cricket at its most beautiful. Innovation after innovation, and they have stormed right back into this match
good shot from Hussey, the extra-cover drive for a couple

Australia are in the tanglest of tangles here, and Kandy is going wild! Flighted delivery, orthodox turner from Herath, dipping slightly, Hussey plays all around it, the ball doesn't turn to make it look worse. Clatter behind Hussey
full outside off, driven to extra cover
slightly round-arm, gets big turn, Smith manges to defend it back to Herath
another big turner, pitches outside leg, hits his thigh pad in front of off
full and straight, pushed back to Smith
big offreak, hits White high on the pad
tries the big sweep, gets a big inside edge onto the pad, will get a single
short, hit-me delivery, but Australia are so tentative this is pushed to midwicket
turned to leg, gets a single
pushed to long-on for one
flighted outside off, driven back to Perera
full legbreak, pushed square but finds point
clever shot, paddled over the keeper's head for two. Can't set fields for those
that turned a yard after pitching middle and off, and what a one-handed take from Sanga, there was hardly any time to adjust for this one
the wrong'un, pushed back to the bowler
top work from Sanga, anticipates the White paddle and moves well down the leg side to take a hit on the chest. And he is admonishing himself for not taking the catch. That was not a chance
driven down to long-off for one now
short ball, pushed to long-on for one
guided wide of point for a single
the premeditated sweep from well outside off, gets a leg-bye
full and quick, pushed to midwicket, another dot
this would have been a sure wide down the leg side, but Smith intervened and glanced it fine of short fine for four
short and flat, turned to backward square leg for one
flighted on the pads, turned around the corner for one
flighted outside off, tentatively defended back
White charges at Mendis, who pulls the length back, White is in no position to play a shot, and thrusts a pad at him

that's more of what Australia need, a nice juicy full toss, and White makes room, and clears long-off by inches. Wonder how Mathews would have reacted had he - and not Kulasekara - been fielding there
chips down the track, and drives this straight, only for Mendis to make a diving save off his own bowling
this seems to be the arm ball, quick, fired in at off, Smith has to hurry into bringing the bat down. No run as this goes straight to short third
comes down the track to place it into the on side for a single
bear pays a superb shot here... he has begun to look confident now. Makes room, goes inside-out, goes bug, over extra cover. That's the White we knew in the better days
and a lovely follow-up for that six, placed with soft hands, just wide of long-on, and hares back for the second
length ball, on the pads, turned around the corner for a single
carrom ball, but misdirected, pitches leg, and goes further down
Smith dances down the track to play the forward defensive, more because he realised he wasn't close to the pitch of the delivery
turned around the corner for a single
big sweep, along the ground, gets a single to deep square
White pushes this legbreak down to long-on for another single, this partnership looks good for Australia
comes down the track, drops this into the on side with soft hands, runs hard, but the second is not on
played against the turn for a single, there is not one man inside the circle on the on side, and Jeevan Mendis is having to do the fielding himself
short and wide, but he has pulled this down to long-on for one

Mendis is operating in a language completely alien to the Aussies. There is this massive panic that is overcoming them at the sight of Mendis. Smith has been playing good orthodox cricket until now, but he makes room here, and this carrom ball goes straight on as opposed to turning away. Smith's bat is outside the line, the middle stumps is out of ground, and Kandy is on its feet

Whoa! Five six, pick up the sticks! Australia are not reading him at all. Increase the font size, Ajantha. This is the googly, well flighted, Hadding plays for the leg break, this pitches well outside off, and takes the top of off. Five wickets in 14 balls! First five-for for SL in T20Is
bowls the carrom ball on the pads, turned past the forward short leg for two
the floated across the left-hander, pushed to cover
the flighted googly, beats Johnson, what a top over
googly again, but too short, and pulled powerfully to deep midwicket - three runs and two wickets off the over
googly, beats Johnson comprehensively, misses the top of off by inches
pushes to midwicket and sets off for a desperate single, Dilshan misses
legbreak, full, outside off, heaved along the ground to long-on
another googly, pushed back to Mendis
googly again, too obvious, hit down to long-off for one
the slog-sweep from White, beats deep midwicket. White keeps Australia alive

That's a valuable shot for four byes! Johnson looks for the reverse-lap, blind-sighting Sangakkara, the ball beats both the batsman and the keeper. this would have been a wide had Johnson not tried the reverse shot
the googly, which Johnson reads and cuts this towards sweeper-cover. Chandimal over-runs it initially, but makes a desperate dive to prevent this boundary

Six and out! Mendis becomes the first bowler to take six wickets in a T20I innings. Carrom ball this time, short and asking to be pulled, Johnson tries the shot, but this one deviates just a little to beat the bat, and hit the stumps
the googly, O'Keefe goes deep into the crease and pushes this down to long-on

the carrom ball, White comes down the crease, pushes this towards long-on with soft hands, always wants the second, and comes for it. Jayawardene chases from midwicket, puts the slide in, the throw is right beside the stumps, and O'Keefe's dive ends inches short. This is top stuff from Sri Lanka
carrom ball again, worked away off the pads for a single. White keeps strike, but what about Mendis? 4-1-16-6, including a double-wicket maiden! best figures in T20Is

a gentle full toss, White gives it an almighty heave, gets a thick edge to third man. They don't take the second despite the fumble in the deep. Called no-ball for height. identical height to the Jayawardene faced earlier. At least they are consistent
yorker outside off, beats his jab, gets a precious dot through
another yorker wide of off, Hastings has backed away, which makes it impossible for him to reach this. Smart bowling
another yorker full and wide, Hastings moves towards off, then backs away, but still doesn't manage contact with the ball
full toss, heaves at it, gets a thick edge for a single to third man
another full toss, hit powerfully down the ground, but not straight enough of long-on. However, he comes back for two
but it wouldn't have mattered if there were all 10 of them, White gets under this length ball and muscles it over wide long-on for six
Hastings does his job by driving this half-volley to long-off. White on strike now
and there's the game for Sri Lanka! This is a low full toss, White makes room and goes for the six, all he manages is an inside edge onto the off stump
gets an inside edge on a length ball, which goes past short fine for a couple
length ball outside off, heaved down to long-on for a single
Sri Lanka have won barring extras now. Hastings slogs and gets a single to long-on. The crowd erupts. Ajantha Mendis applauds
wide full toss, hit down the ground for one. Sri Lanka have won 2-0. Mendis is overjoyed, and why not
